Literature Review: The shift towards virtual work has significantly impacted how leaders interact with their followers, necessitating a reevaluation of traditional leadership functions and the development of new strategies to facilitate effective virtual leadership. This literature review aims to synthesize the findings of virtual leadership research, applying functional leadership theory to identify key functions that influence follower need satisfaction in virtual settings. We also explore the implications of leading in hybrid work environments and outline practical recommendations for organizations, leaders, and their followers.
